adjective.description: Shaped like or approximately like a circle or cylinder.
examples: she was seated at a small, round table

adjective.description: Shaped like or approximately like a sphere.
examples: the grapes are small and round

adjective.description: (of a voice) rich and mellow; not harsh.
(of a number) altered for convenience of expression or calculation, for example to the nearest whole number or multiple of ten or five.
examples: the size of the fleet is given in round numbers

adjective.description: (of a person or their manner of speaking) not omitting or disguising anything; frank and truthful.
examples: she berated him in good round terms

noun.description: A circular piece of a particular substance.
An act of visiting each of a number of people or places.
examples: she did the rounds of her family to say goodbye
he made the rounds of the city's churches

noun.description: One of a sequence of sessions or groups of related actions or events, typically such that development or progress can be seen between one group and another.
examples: the two sides held three rounds of talks

noun.description: A regularly recurring sequence of activities or functions.
examples: their lives were a daily round of housework and laundry

noun.description: A song for three or more unaccompanied voices or parts, each singing the same theme but starting one after another, at the same pitch or in octaves; a simple canon.
The amount of ammunition needed to fire one shot.

verb.description: Pass and go around (something) so as to move on in a changed direction.
examples: the ship rounded the cape and sailed north

verb.description: Alter (a number) to one less exact but more convenient for calculations.
examples: we'll round the weight up to the nearest pound
the committee rounded down the figure
let's just round it off to an even ten dollars
a lathe that rounded chair legs

phrases: The turn from relief to sculpture in the round led to radical changes in his work.
Whether in reliefs or figures carved in the round, he achieved dramatic expression of emotion through the intense faces, emphatic gestures, and cascading draperies of his figures.
They are not sculpture in the round, but the pieces can be viewed from either side.
Standing just 36 cm high, and carved in the round, the model for the Queen Charlotte's figurehead is a tour de force of the woodcarver's art, although its maker's name is as yet unknown.
Also carved in the round is a seated female figure just over one inch in height.
round off the spars with a soft plastic fitting
I tested the tip of one, but evidently they were purely aesthetic, the tips and edges were rounded off so that they couldn't possibly harm anyone.
The sharp edges, corners and points have been rounded off and smoothed away.
One nice thing about this case is that all of the edges are rounded off, you'd be hard pressed to find a place where you could cut yourself without really trying.
The square edges will be rounded off to prevent further damage to the wall.
origin: Middle English: from the Old French stem round-, from a variant of Latin rotundus rotund.
